meanings.definition: To rig or set up again.
meanings.sent1: After the storm, they rerigged the sails on the boat.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic rerigged the engine to make it run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The pirates rerigged their ship just in time for the next adventure.
meanings.sent4: She rerigged her bike with colorful streamers for the parade.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut rerigged her spacesuit before the spacewalk.

meanings.definition: To adjust or repair the rigging of a ship.
meanings.sent1: The sailors rerigged the mast to ensure it was secure.
meanings.sent2: The crew rerigged the ropes to withstand the strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The captain rerigged the sails with extra care to impress the passengers.
meanings.sent4: They rerigged the net to catch more fish in the deep sea.
meanings.sent5: He rerigged the flagpole to proudly display the flag.

meanings.definition: To outfit or equip with new rigging.
meanings.sent1: The team rerigged the boat with the latest technology for the race.
meanings.sent2: They rerigged the stage with colorful lights for the performance.
meanings.sent3: The explorers rerigged their backpacks with extra supplies for the journey.
meanings.sent4: She rerigged the tent with stronger poles for camping in the wilderness.
meanings.sent5: The workers rerigged the scaffolding for safety at the construction site.
